result.execSummary:
The defendant Omar Nevarez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: consecutive to any sentence; straight time.
Probation Review Hearing schedule for November 18, 2022 at 9:00 am.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all costs/surcharges including the DNA surcharge by August 4, 2023 or be docketed as a civil judgment/tax intercept. Bail on deposit to be applied.
Pay all supervision fees.
Restitution set at zero.

No contact with the victim.
No new violations of the law that rise to the level of probable cause.
Court will allow expungement upon successful completion of all conditions of probation.

Sex Offender evaluation and comply with any treatment.
Court imposed and stayed Sex Offender Registration.

AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
Absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Omar Nevarez

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed, Letter regarding commitment information and conditions.

Defendant Omar Nevarez in court with attorney Glenn Edward Gaskill.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Sentencing proceeded.  State compliant with victim notification.  State's offer placed on the record.  Statements by the State, Defense and Defendant as to sentencing.

Court ordered defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; straight time; credit for 2 days time served.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the Defendant on probation for 1 YEAR with the following conditions:

- Court ordered 20 days condition time in the House of Correction IMPOSED AND STAYED.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Sex Offender evaluation and comply with any treatment.
- Absolute sobriety.
- No contact with the victim.
- Maintain continuing education.
- Seek/maintain employment.
- No new violations of the law that rise to the level of probable cause.
- Pay all costs/surcharges including the DNA surcharge by August 4, 2023 or to be docketed as a civil judgment/tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied.  
- Pay all supervision fees
- No contact with weapons/firearms
- Restitution set at zero.

Court imposed and stayed Sex Offender Registration.

Court will allow expungement upon successful completion of all conditions of probation.  
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Omar Nevarez in court with attorney Glenn Edward Gaskill.  Student Intern Jessica Birmingham under the supervision of Emily S. Zimmel for Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for Plea Hearing.  Parties have reached a resolution.  Plea Hearing held.

AS TO COUNT 1.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, that a plea of guilty or no contest to the crime you are charged may result in deportation, exclusion from admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ACA.
Balance of Bail on Deposit to be return to the provider.

ADDRESS INFO for Omar Nevarez
Current: 3407 S 59th Ave, Cicero, IL 60804 United States  (Effective: 05-03-2022)
Prior: 915 West Wisconsin Avenue #1815, Milwaukee, WI 53233

Defendant Omar Nevarez in court with attorney Glenn Edward Gaskill.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: nk
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.
